alert.note: Alert for Liberty; Polk; San Jacinto (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 9:37AM CST until January 27 at 9:02PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Trinity River near Goodrich affecting San Jacinto, Polk and Liberty Counties. For the Trinity River...including Crockett, Riverside, Romayor, Goodrich, Liberty, Moss Bluff...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Trinity River near Goodrich. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 36.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins as water spreads out over fields and threatens buildings in the immediate vicinity of the gage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CST Saturday the stage was 36.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 33.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 AM CST Saturday was 38.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 19.6 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 36.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 35.5 feet on 05/22/1983. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Trinity River Goodrich 36.0 36.0 Sat 8 am CST 33.4 31.4 26.1 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoonthis evening at 915 PM CST.
